intro: Mitrosicyos lobatus, commonly known as the African snakeloot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a climbing vine characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native region.
